Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraoperative Molecular Imaging with a Targeted Contrast Agent for Lung Adenocarcinomas

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial enrolled 50 patients

Intervention.evidence: Patients received 0.1 mg/kg of a fluorescent folate receptor alpha (FRα)-targeted molecular contrast agent intravenously pre-surgery.

Objective.evidence: This trial assesses a targeted molecular contrast agent for real-time optical imaging of lung adenocarcinomas during surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative identification of fluorescent tumors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial enrolled 50 patients
